website_summaries.verdict: A sinister villain, some tough choices, and a new kind of multiplayer arena invigorate the reliably intense action in Call of Duty: Black Ops II.
pros: Great campaign scriptingStory choices are often tough and encourage replayLeague play offers a new stage for the familiar multiplayer combat
cons: Zombies mode is stagnantNew codcasting tool is hamstrungTechnical limitations hamper live streaming feature

customer_reviews.title: Capture the flag!!
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorites! The campaign is challenging and the difficulty setting really does change the game play. Playing online with others on capture the flag is my absolute favorite way to spend my time playing this game.
customer_reviews.author: HaileyJ

customer_reviews.title: By this point it's already dated but what the heck
customer_reviews.text: So I wasn't a fan of the first Black Ops, I wasn't a fan of the annualization of Call of Duty, but this game was breath of fresh air. New futuristic setting, cool gadgets and a branching storyline. I'm not a fan of CoD multiplayer...I'm a battlefield guy myself, but I found myself able to play this one. But my most favorite part about this game are the BOTS! BOTS! BOTS! BOTS! Couple that with the ability to use any item in the game and you got a recipe for a really good CoD. This is easily the best CoD released, but Ghosts is pretty close with its alien horde mode. Story good, guns cool, and zombies! Play this game.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Very good game but not as good as Black Ops 1
customer_reviews.text: Very good game but not as good as Black Ops 1. Especially in zombies. But the multiplayer is a little more fun because of the vast amount of kill streaks. But there seems to be less weapons and its based in a modern/futuristic setting which is cliche. But tranzit is fun and has many Easter eggs inside the maps. So i would buy here i got it more cheap here than in gamestop but i would check both amazon and gamestop to get the better buy. Plus it seems amazon games are just kept in better shape than a game store.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: It is CoD, only crappier.
customer_reviews.text: The storyline was crap and had more holes than swiss. But really, no one buys this series for the single player. Which is good, because it felt like an after thought. The multiplayer is what you expect from the CoD franchise. There is no significant divergence from the mold, regardless of what the developers have said. This is the same Call of Duty you've been playing for years. If nothing else, make the switch to keep up with the large player base and leave the elitists to play the one game they are good at.
customer_reviews.author: C.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great game.
customer_reviews.text: This game is rather interesting. Multiplayer provides a fun and competive atmosphere, while catering to more elite players by adding in Diamond camo. Campaign is first of it's kind in a CoD game. Featuring sandbox play (The choices you make in game change the over all outcome) as well as strike force missions. Zombies is jam packed with things to do. You can choose to survive or you can attempt to complete the Easter eggs if you're up for the challenge. Would buy again. Would recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Decent game nothing really special
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I'm giving it 5 stars is because of the shipping and amazing donation of the disk. I honestly thought I got a new disk even tho I bought it used. Very excellent shipping, by far the best most friendlist customer service. I highly recommend the buyer. Now the game itself is COD... Same song and dance. Good game but same graphics although they seem a bit more cartoony now and gameplay is the same, nothing has changed. I have not played campaign or zombies only Multiplayer so I can not speak for those parts of the game. All in all wait for the price to drop before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Don't let fanboys persuade you
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun, pure and simple. It isn't a new groundbreaking idea and it doesn't even try to be. It is the same sort of fun you would have in all the previous games just with slight to moderate tweaks and improvements. Of course you will come across the same chatty younger friends, but you will also have the same fun you did shooting mindlessly in the franchises past games. Black Ops II offers some improvements over black ops but keeps all the great aspects of the previous game, including zombies, funnier plots and a massive multiplayer experience.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Soukenik

customer_reviews.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
customer_reviews.text: This was a game that I was truly looking forward to, but ended up somewhat disappointed. The campaign is so so, a little scattered without the concrete story lines that the Modern Warfare series had. The multiplayer seems to be more of a rehash than anything new. It just feels like they are starting to mail these in. The maps are generally small, and don't offer the intrigue that we were used to in older games. I'd buy it used if I could do it over again. These end up being 100 dollar investments if you get the DLC. For that kind of money I expect better.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Knoblich

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Big fan of the CoD franchise and have played most of them. If you liked black ops, you will like this as well. Story was good, controls tight, visuals as expected. The campaign was interesting, villain was worthy and I had fun playing it. MP is more of the same. Some new weapons and a different kind of point system for setting up a class. Maps are reasonably good, not too many set up for spawn kills. Lack of spawn delay means you do get killed right away sometimes though. The previous delay was too long but this is now too short. Fun as usual.
customer_reviews.author: TT in MA

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Par.
customer_reviews.text: This game was a disappointment. I had to get rid of it before the going rate of exchange dropped too low. There were issues (which might have been solved) regarding hit markers, lag compensation and broken melee. Some of those issues were fixed within a month of release, however most were largely ignored. Even the campaign was horrid. This game was so bad that I went back to the original Black Ops and played that to get the taste out of my mouth. Now I'm enjoying Call of Duty Ghosts much more. I'm glad that I got rid of BO2.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Villavicencio

customer_reviews.title: Another COD game to enjoy
customer_reviews.text: I am still in the middle of playing the storyline, so far it is nice and I can't give it a 5 because I do not know how the ending is going to be, and because the story line is a little complex and they go back and forth that they make it annoying for the player to keep track of it. Game play is nice, multiplayer gaming is also addictive, however I find that there is game lag in most games that I play, makes it really difficult to get those kills if their bullets reach you first!
customer_reviews.author: F.K

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT EVER RECIEVE IT
customer_reviews.text: Cant rate the product it self because, I never received it. This was a gift I ordered before Thanksgiving. and waited until the final day of expected delivery I then contacted the seller and they said wait few more days which I did, then come Christmas eve after several messages back and forth, they said it was shipped but no tracking information was applied so we had issues on whether I was trying to scam them. After days of confusion and finally I received a full refund on the merchandise. However, this made it no easier for my 9 year old who was waiting on this gift. all in all the seller did as promised and gave me my money.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Bodden Gelaro

customer_reviews.title: It's Call of Duty
customer_reviews.text: You probably know what you're getting with this product. I purchased it for the online multiplayer and zombies, and I've gotten my money's worth. If you liked Black Ops, you'll probably like Black Ops II. The spawn points seem to be a problem, or maybe it's all the kids with the strategy guides camping the spawn...I'm not sure. Once you get spawn killed 7 times in a row, and killed by flying C4 a few times, you'll see why I couldn't go above 3 stars. It's not a bad game, but after so many CALL OF DUTY games, I expect a little bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Tired of kids on here.
customer_reviews.text: The game itself is fun but my big issue is all the kids under the age of 16/17 that are playing this game. It is full of foul language (the online part, the single player has cursing but nothing compared to what I have been said to BY CHILDREN) I had a 7 year old in a round a couple nights ago fropping f-bombs like he got paid to. Kinda ridiculous. The game itself is alright, spawn placement is weak in this one. It is fun to spawn and watch your killcam 3 seconds later because you see yourself appear in front of someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Richard D. Cameron III

customer_reviews.title: COD
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge fan of call of duty, but when I started to play this game, I was speechless. Awesome game play but I wished that you can customize a class on level 1. Shipping came the day before the prediction, which is very good, This is my second COD in my Xbox library. I would recommend this game, but I would prefer playing this on a flat screen for the graphics, I'm planning to take down this old TV and put in this flat-screen that's been sitting in my basement for awhile. But overall,it was a good buy. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Rikki Boodram

customer_reviews.title: Great game, but you get nickle and dimed at every corner.
customer_reviews.text: The game is around $60, and then they want another $40 for the add-on maps. There are a very limited number of maps. Maps are super easy to make, but they won't let us make our own maps. The weapon systems are pretty balanced. There some are better than others, but it doesn't seem like there is one setup that dominates the rest. If you like FPS, you'll like this. Also, get some 5.1 headphones, that really gives you an edge. You can hear enemies and shoot them before they know you're there.
customer_reviews.author: Some Random Guy

customer_reviews.title: Held his interest....mostly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as a late Christmas gift. With most of the Call of Duty and Black Ops games, he played them until he beat them, unable to help himself. This one he played for a day or two, and then stopped. I'm not sure if it just lost his interest or if he got busy. I know that in the past with other games, nothing stopped him from losing sleep and making sure he beat the game in record time though...so I gave the game 4 stars. When asked he said he liked it, but that's the only response I got.
customer_reviews.author: Liz J.

customer_reviews.title: The Best of the Call of Duty Series since World At War
customer_reviews.text: This game took a hit for some of their bad distribution/pricing ideas in the beginning and it led me almost to not buy it. I'm glad I made my own decision. The campaign is the most interesting since since Modern Warfare 2 (Blacks Ops 1 seemed trite). And the zombies are the best yet (which are what keep me coming back). I haven't done too much yet of the multi-player, but I came in getting shot to death less than in Black Ops 1. I have been playing this game for a month and I'm still enjoying it immensely.
customer_reviews.author: lazyfives

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Game
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 14 yr old. It has been playing on the Xbox almost non-stop since its release. Its being played right now and when I wake up in the morning it will probably be playing then too. The kids are starting to hop around, dodge, and peek around corners before they enter a room. I think thats a good thing. Keeps them active and on their toes. But seriously I am amazed that the graphics are so good when the Xbox is soooo old! And the zombie levels are really cool, too.
customer_reviews.author: T. Plunkett

customer_reviews.title: Liked the storyline, gamepay gets tedious at times.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a fanboy and probably old enough to be most of the players grandfather. I play for some mindless relaxation and stress relief. Playing online can get aggravating though since i routinely get killed by 8 year olds. Who lets them play this game anyways? Wait, i am starting to sound like my father. So, shutup, play it, and then turn it off. Another version will arrive next year. I am not a big gamer but play a few as released. Nothing says family love like a father, daughter zombie match.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Goodman

customer_reviews.title: NUKETOWN!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best Call of Duty's produced to date in my opinion. The maps are great and nuketown is the best map for horrible shooters like myself to just lob grenades and kill people randomly
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ingalls

customer_reviews.title: Like the game, took time to get used to
customer_reviews.text: Took me 2 weeks to get used to the different game play compared to Black Ops 1 but overall the game is good. Story mode is entertaining and unlocking achievements will keep you busy for some time. The bonus map nuketown on the other hand won't work. If you buy this version beware, it may say it includes it, but you won't be able to play it. It will just take space on your hard drive, something to do with redeeming it within first few weeks of game launch is what I've discovered to be the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: More run and gun - no strategy!
customer_reviews.text: There is no place to settle in anywhere. Now I now some will say that's camping, but I find not dying, killing and winning slowly and with purpose more exciting than cage fighting! Maybe its my age - but there is no more gaming here than run and gun! Boring! This review is solely based on Multiplayer - I play hardcore only! Maps need to be larger and more open so you can use different techniques, weapons and strategies!
customer_reviews.author: California Academy Of Health

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW...
customer_reviews.text: Let me start out by saying, I SUCK at first person shooters... that said, i still have a blast going online and having 10 year old kids kick my butt all over the map. its also worth while to hear how serious some "players" take the game... The story mode is fun as well. it does not prep you for online play AT ALL!!! (the cpu dont jump all over and all that crazy stuff) pretty easy to play through. Zombies, only played a few times, judgement reserved.
customer_reviews.author: John Haas

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the COD line
customer_reviews.text: I loved Black Ops so I was excited they were coming out with a sequel. I really enjoy the fact they made the wager matches into experience based choices. They aren't without their faults though (in One in the Chamber, the UAV stays on so you can see the enemies). It's a great experience, but beware the struggling Treyarch servers. The Live experience glitches more than most of the previous games. Hopefully the updates will fix the server issues, but a fun game nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: nfrank2

customer_reviews.title: GLITCHY!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game EXCEPT it glitches like crazy. I like to play zombies and it has a super fun version where you now play zombies in a multi-player mode with 8 people. The only problem is about 9/10 games will have some sort of problem where you or your teammates get glitched out of the game. After that happens they cannot rejoin the game either. Even simple things like inviting a friend to a chat party is very very glitchy, only works after minutes of attempts.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It arrived fast and my husband has been playing it a lot
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat different
customer_reviews.text: As an avid Modern Warfare player, I was used to the way Infinity Ward did things. I finally decided I would try Treyarch out. At first I did not like the game at all. They graphics didn't seem as good as MW3 and the movement felt weird. I've gotten used to it and now I enjoy playing it. The maps are refreshing and the way things are done is pretty neat. I would recommend this game at a price less than $40, however I would not purchase this if it costs more.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Purtee

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality disc.
customer_reviews.text: Disc is unreadable and noticeably scratched. Can't get my xbox to read it at all!
customer_reviews.author: AnarchistOWl

customer_reviews.title: Different Enough
customer_reviews.text: This next installment in the Call of Duty lineup is a solid release. The multi-player online is competitive and different enough from the previous installments to be worth the money. The single-player campaign is not much different from that of previous versions. Given the age of the franchise, it is impressive that each installment has enough advancements and maintains the quality and integrity of the game well enough to be a solid purchase. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent; Cannot Recommend Enough.
customer_reviews.text: Came in brand new and in an excellent quality. As for the game, it's fun in both story and online. However, if you're buying this in 2018, I have to report that the online is barely enjoyable anymore as it is bombarded with hackers (It's hard for me to find a single game that's not hacked). Although I found a trick to fix this is to set your connection type to normal instead of any, it works most of the time but it could take a while to find a game. Nonetheless​, great game.
customer_reviews.author: Manar AlRawahi

customer_reviews.title: Almost a perfect game.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, finished this game within a week of getting it... great graphics, exciting action, and a great challenge to your skill. One glitch I found was nearing the end of the game, the direction arrow stuck in two scenes that led nowhere. Also during the scene while riding the horse, you see a tank that has ride on it, but you can't get close enough to jump on. Otherwise, this is a great game for both single players and team play.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Demers

customer_reviews.title: It's Black Ops II
customer_reviews.text: That should tell you right there, you either love it or you don't. While there is a drastic improvement over Black Ops I I am still a Modern Warfare fan and only pick this up to tide me over until the next game. Although I do wish people would consider the fact that this game is rated Mature. I have encountered children countless times using language that is wildly inappropriate and I wish parents would consider this when looking into this game.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Lamas

customer_reviews.title: Why I like or dislike?
customer_reviews.text: I think that Call of Duty is a good game with a few unique missions and a few intels that are located in some odd places unlike in the game of Ghost Recon. It seems that Call of Duty takes you in the future and past worlds of Cartels and a few other 3rd World crisis. The weapons are a lot more modern in this game and a lot of battle locations are more modern which makes the game a lot of fun. I can't wait to get the next one, later!
customer_reviews.author: WILLIE COBB

customer_reviews.title: Great game if you have the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this game for the first time and it was great. The maps are larger and lots of places to rush and capture flag's or headquarters.The game update's and new DLC map pack's and other pack's come out.I got the season pass and my favorite map over all would be mirage lot's of hiding, In so a few week's after my disk cracked and in so i had to order my second black ops 2 game. So waiting patiently for the knew black ops 2 to come.
customer_reviews.author: Jaden Nichols

customer_reviews.title: It's the same old call of duty!!
customer_reviews.text: You know I have put hundreds of hours into each one of these games and played them all the way until the next release. I even am a Elite member for all of the add ons and dlc's. I liked this game just as well as all the rest but I finally think I am bored with the series and have only played it around a 1/3 as much as the other call of duties!!! They better mix it up or I think this series is going to lose against Battlefield or another shooter! Still I give it a 7.5 to 8, just like all the rest.
customer_reviews.author: GutlessMeteor

customer_reviews.title: kicking ass
customer_reviews.text: When I broke my Original Call of Duty: Black Ops, I was really distressed and bothered. It was my favorite game to play almost everyday after school, and I could play hours on end. Edventually it became too scratched and I had to toss it. Soon upon time, I had gotten into a relationship and my boyfriend suggested for my to try it out. It's no original Black Ops, but the second is really good and I love it :) Me and my boyfriend love playing together, since we love to tease and compete with the other. Girls, I suggest getting this game and playing with your boyfriend. It's a great way to have some good fun! :3
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: YES
customer_reviews.text: The best in the COD series. Take any variant that Sledgehammer, or Infinity Ward has published and throw them away. Ghosts was garbage, MW died out after #2. And Advanced Warfare is too halo. Jetpacks? Give me a break. Black Ops 2 still has 150,000 players online in the evenings and never fails to offer quality content.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: What more to say...BOO season pass model...
customer_reviews.text: the Season pass is here to stay...paying roughly an extra $50 per FPS shooter for a subscription to all of the DLC...putting early gamers at $60 for game and $50 for DLC...then the game gets stale and its off to the next iteration. The game is fun, ive only touched multiplayer but there are many options for single player fun too, overall i like it, but sick of spending over $110 a year to stay fresh with the great COD series...
customer_reviews.author: Brannon Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fresh take on COD
customer_reviews.text: I'm guessing I'm not the only person who was getting bored with the standard COD fare. Every year a new rendition of the same game comes out and after a couple weeks I am bored with the same formula that was released last year. Black Ops 2 breaks the mold quite a bit. Don't get me wrong, it is still COD but it tells an intelligent story and the changes to the multiplayer (Pick 10) keeps it fresh. I loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Yerger

customer_reviews.title: interesting game, the reviews are true
customer_reviews.text: The violence can't be muted, but there are ways to play it without the bad language and by carefully choosing friends. I'm not going to pretend that this is a family friendly game for everyone, but I actually don't think the scenes are gratuitously gory or bloody. It's a war game, and the other guys are bad guys, and the goal is to subdue the enemy - as opposed to rampaging over the innocent on the streets.
customer_reviews.author: Grizzrob

customer_reviews.title: Idk
customer_reviews.text: Not so sure about this seller because the mods are excessive online and now my harddrive needs to be formatted all of a sudden.
customer_reviews.author: Isiah

customer_reviews.title: yep only 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: I give the game 5 stars...However the online play is crap. With all the money these guys are getting you would think that they would have more stable servers and would be able to weed out the cheaters and boosters. Come on, if a player only has been online 3 weeks there is no way he has prestiged to the max. I am realy disapointed in Activision on this one. They have put out some amazing games in the past, but they allowed hackers and cheaters to ruin this game for anyone that just wants to have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Erich D. Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Best thing about this game is bots. Campaign is inappropriate
customer_reviews.text: My favorite thing about this game is the bots and that is why I bought it. You can play by yourself without being an online gamer and choose your bots skill level. I do not like the campaign and feel it is very inappropriate for youth and adults alike. The violence is expected but showing inocent people getting killed, especially kids, is just evil; not to mention all the uncalled for profanity.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A few scratches but plays perfect
customer_reviews.text: Game plays well there are a few scratches but that is expected with a used game no manual in the case but I don't need it anyways. Case was a little dirty but other than that the graphic on case was still intact and graphics on disc were not scratched. Just shows general use wear.
customer_reviews.author: Emo Popsicle

customer_reviews.title: Addictive
customer_reviews.text: Campaign, zombie, and online multi-player all are well made. Haven't gotten too far in campaign, but the story is good, and the cinematic scenes are well made. Zombies is fun but can be frustrating. The real gem is multi-player. It's hard to stop. The rewards, customization of your gear layout, and gameplay are all top-notch. Lag is an issue, but what game isn't that a problem with? Get this game.
customer_reviews.author: Meh

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what he wanted!
customer_reviews.text: MY son requested this game for his birthday. I ordered it and it arrived promptly. He birthday was 3 weeks after the purchase(we wanted to make sure we had it). After he played it a few times it stopped working. I did a return to Amazon and ordered a new one. That transaction went flawlessly and he was back to playing in no time. The second game worked correctly and is still working fine.
customer_reviews.author: USChiMar

customer_reviews.title: Not fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is just terrible. Only the zombies make it worth playing. Once you finish the missions, I am stuck in multiplayer against people who a re awesome and kill me in 5 seconds. The game claims to have a beginner mode, but it wasn't beginner enough for me. Yes, I have a job, a wife and other obligations and am not very good because of those life commitments. The game should be fun even for people who don't have 12 spare hours a day to play video games.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L

customer_reviews.title: Best. Game. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: If you like war games, this is one for you. The campaign storyline is pretty good, and the multiplayer/live portion is amazing. Most of the time was definitely spent on creating the multiplayer portion of the game. The graphics are great, the gameplay is great, and customizing your classes is new compared to the first Black Ops. There are many improvements that have been made that make this one of the best war games out there. I would definitely recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: BGilbert

customer_reviews.title: Call of doodie?
customer_reviews.text: Treyarch have ruined yet another game. The lack of dedicated servers, terrible lag compensation, corporate greed, overexposure in the media, flat multiplayer maps, and lack of customer support or interest are among many reasons that this game isn't worth the $6 it took to make it. Don't waste your time on this rage-feeding, anger-inducing pathetic excuse for a video game.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin S

customer_reviews.title: ... am a big fan of RHONJ and I just love this book
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of RHONJ and I just love this book. I just cant put it down. This is one of my favorite couples on TV I even had followed some of Melissa Gorga avice. shes awesome!!!
customer_reviews.author: PinkBossLady39

customer_reviews.title: More of the same, some new integration
customer_reviews.text: It's kinda like black ops meets world at war. I hit a glitch where one of the strikeforce missions would not recognize as completed which really kinda screwed me as this game has multiple endings and because of it I got one of the not so good ones. As always with these games, it's kinda frustrating getting your ass handed to you by 12 year olds on multiplayer, the servers are swamped with youngin's. Overall, fun but it's still the same "shoot the guy" game that we've seen since the franchise's inception. What sells sells though right?
customer_reviews.author: Tony Mac

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my brother.
customer_reviews.text: I love the COD franchise but I needed a break. These games are fun but it is always the same issues with the multiplayer. Campers, cheaters, griefer's, weasels, bad teammates, bad spawns, amazing players teamed up against normal players, etc. I'm sure the game is awesome and fun but I needed a break. Master Chief is back and he is my boy.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: COD BO2
customer_reviews.text: Had the game since it came out and they actually got this game right unlike the other ones. I never bought a treyarch game before this one, but now ill definitely get some more from them! Best part of the game is the new maps and diamond gun camo after you get all the other camos for each of the classes! The multilayer mode surpasses any other COD game!
customer_reviews.author: Edgar F.

customer_reviews.title: A game for the entire family!
customer_reviews.text: Even with the ratings for blood and shooting my entire family plays this game even I do. The xbox is always on to CODII. How ever we do prefer COD I. COD II is not bad at all A lot better than Ghost which was a game that should have never been put on the market to begin with. I would recommend this game to ALL COD lovers!
customer_reviews.author: Nini

customer_reviews.title: Great Follow Up
customer_reviews.text: While nothing incredibly new for this game franchise, this is a good step forward in terms of gameplay. Multiplayer online seems to do a much better job of balancing matches. Weapons options are based on a token system that allows you the customized the available weaponry to your choices, nice. And the storyline game can hold it's own as well.
customer_reviews.author: JDM

customer_reviews.title: Black ops 2 was way better then Black ops 1 with improvement
customer_reviews.text: Black ops 2 was way better then Black ops 1 with improvement, I don't know if anyone play this, but the campaign story is was better, and online is fun and enjoyable, You don't have to worry and jet packs, and you get to keep your feet on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: FireHawq

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: More of the same, little if anything new with this iteration. Horrible sound effects. I think the COD games have plateaued, I won't be buying more of their products in the future. It needs an overhaul, something fresh. Of course, I'm 42 y/o and my tastes vary and I'm certainly in the vast minority of users with this review.

customer_reviews.title: Great time killer
customer_reviews.text: Never played the previous Black Ops game but did play the other CODMW games. If you are a fan of those, this one is more of the same, with new settings branching storyline and an overhaul to the multiplayer design. I think the multiplayer overhaul is the breath of fresh air this series needed, and prestiging is much easier than before, and more rewarding I think.
customer_reviews.author: Nachovilla243

customer_reviews.title: Black Ops
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this game. Zombies is about the only thing worth playing for sure and is a lot of fun. Multiplier mode isn't as fun and the knifing still sucks to no end. The guns and maps aren't very impressive or creative either. The maps are redone versions of maps from mw3 and such which is kind of sad. I was hoping for more creative or interesting things, but I guess not. The camo however is pretty cool and the kill strikes aren't half bad. When you do play this game with 2 players on multiplier, it tends to be very glitchy. Maybe the next maps will be better...
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fun with flaws
customer_reviews.text: No game is perfect but there is way to many problems in this one. I have a fast internet speed so lag compensating gets me a lot. Spawn dying is another annoying one. Oh and migrating hosts. I do play it a lot but feel like i cant play long because of these problems. Where is my nuketown 2025 i was supposed to get for preordering? RIPOFF 3/5
customer_reviews.author: Nick S

customer_reviews.title: Call of Duty is one of my favorites
customer_reviews.text: The online gaming can be frustrating sometimes. I always enjoy the story. Overall, as far as the seller goes, the game was in perfect shape when I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Same as the first black ops. 2 steps under MW3
customer_reviews.text: Its HORRIBLE. The maps are a joke. The guns are even worse. The idiots playing do nothing but CAMP. I was on the fence about this game, so I just bought it for $45. I played it for about 2 hours. <online> Just bad everything. The graphics are something to laugh about, the guns sound like fireworks. 2 steps under MW3.
customer_reviews.author: conor kelly

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's fun. There are a lot of game modes, including the addicting Zombies Mode. But multiplayer LAG is infuriating at times. Yes, yes, I have a great connection/speed. I would have hoped they would have come up with a solution to minimize lag further, but it seems to get worse with each iteration of these games.
customer_reviews.author: Randy L. Kieffer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't played COD since the WWII games. I got extremely burnt out on them and Modern Warfare but when this one came around all my friends wanted me to play it with them and so I picked it up. I was extremely impressed and have loved every minute of it! I haven't played the campaign yet, but the multiplayer games and guns are a blast!
customer_reviews.author: James Hall

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: I like it played it twice and no problem with this game really great game I appreciate your business
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Good Story Line
customer_reviews.text: So.. its another awesome shooter game. What more could you ask for, right? How about a longer game play? I know I would love to play a shooter game like this that requires more than 24 hours of Campaign Play. I know its just a game, but limiting your weapon to only 3 extra items, really cuts down on the realism expected from Activision.
customer_reviews.author: Marty B.

customer_reviews.title: Black ops 2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game for my wife she loves it and i loved the price i got it for didnt think it was going to be the original one but when it got here it was and it works great she hasnt stopped playing it since she got it thanks activision for a great deal on your product recommend buying from them first and not paying high bucks for the same game ..thanks again very very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Call of Duty Black ops 2.
customer_reviews.text: Most important was the Game Disc, It came nearly perfect only light scratches here and there. with an added Bonus the Game booklet and also the codes were all in there for being used so i got lucky there. The game Case itself was also like new pretty much from the Retail store of GameStop. Looking forward to making more purchases in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Pauta "SEEK"

customer_reviews.title: I Love It (With A Disclaimer On That Love :)
customer_reviews.text: I don't play video games much, but my boyfriend does. A lot. I mean...a LOT. And this is his favorite above all others. The reason I love it is because HE loves it and it makes him very happy. The disclaimer, however, is I rarely get to see him because he's always playing this #@$%*&^ game! :)
customer_reviews.author: Zyde

customer_reviews.title: good game
customer_reviews.text: I just started playing FPS on console and Black Ops II is definitely a great game to buy. I haven't tried multiplayer yet, but single player campaign was great and lots fun. You get to go through with a whole bunch of different weapons, futuristic scopes to see through walls and invisible enemies. It was a great game to end 2012.
customer_reviews.author: Zhi Zheng

customer_reviews.title: fun game but there's false advertising involved
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game, although my biggest gripe is that you have to buy more maps after you pay for the game already :/ That's kinda like free iOS games: a big fat lie. Otherwise the game is fun, there's online multiplayer modes, among which zombies is probably the more fun side of this game.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: multiplayer is terrible
customer_reviews.text: this review is based on multiplayer. i do not play zombies or campaign so the review is not based on them. not only is the hit detection terrible but the servers are terrible. match making continually disconnects you and the party gets scattered to the wind. modern warfare 3 is far superior to this game. on the plus side the graphics are nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: By far the best Call of Duty there is
customer_reviews.text: By far the best Call of Duty there is, my favorite is the zombies on here! Perfect to play with a group of friends or by yourself. No internet needed. Very Satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: The multiplayer is inferior to the predecessor, the single ...
customer_reviews.text: The multiplayer is inferior to the predecessor, the single player game lacked cohesion, and the zombie mode was, frankly, disappointing. For your money, buy the first Black Ops. if you're looking for a new-gen FPS, I'd spend the money on Titanfall or Destiny.
customer_reviews.author: DraeS

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't play.
customer_reviews.text: The game didn't work. . Having to pay return shipping made it not even worth returning. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Anna D.

customer_reviews.title: Same S*** Different Game
customer_reviews.text: If you've seen one, you've seen them all. With the same ridiculously grotesque scripted sequences and dated, boring gameplay of every entry post-MW1, this one also attempts to disguise its inept storytelling with a gimmicky choose-your-own-adventure mechanism. Treyarch & Activision should be embarrassed not only to be churning out this garbage, but also to be aggressively marketing torture fantasies to teenagers.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend he said that it came in good condition and worked well. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Kris B

customer_reviews.title: One of the best games out there
customer_reviews.text: Black ops 2 tops all other call of duty games because of their fun zombie mode. The game has great graphics and a realistic feel to it. I would definitely recommend this game to you. Zombies is the reason why I bought this and I wasn't disappointed. If you're a multiplayer fan you will be happy too.
customer_reviews.author: Big time Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Got the game for my little Brothers and they LOVE IT
customer_reviews.author: Kechia stone

customer_reviews.title: Graphics are as good as all of the rest
customer_reviews.text: I have all the call of duty games. This particular game has one segment that I have not been able to beat. I got lost in a tunnel and could not get out. It is the only one I have not played to finish. Graphics are as good as all of the rest.
customer_reviews.author: yjdavis

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic game - my son and I play it all the time with online friends of his and have a great time. Also, Amazon was fantastic about exchanging a defective one we recieved for the new one. I called one night and they overnight shipped it to us, and we had the new one next day. Thanks for the quick service, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Barrett Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Review for Call of Duty: Black Ops II
customer_reviews.text: I love the way when the story line in the campaign shows of when warfare advances through technology and advance computer drones, multiplayer is okay even though you don't have many options to customize your weapon classes, zombies has changed with new characters and new maps each DLC settings along with the next upcoming DLC vengeance.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: yes sir
customer_reviews.text: worth buying this game, even if you are a halo fan and a battlefield fan, this game will blow your mind! i mostly do online play but first i make sure i beat the game at least twice play friends locally so i wont look like a nube for online play, plus our kd wont suck as much either.
customer_reviews.author: BigHomieCed

customer_reviews.title: Best game ever!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer, by any means, this was purchased for my husband who hasn't put it down in months. He's an avid Zombies player and has downloaded all of the map-pack releases since it's release date. He's very happy with it, as are the millions of players across the world. Great game, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: Black OPS II does not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: I have been a fan of this game since the original Call of Duty. This latest release continues with one of the best first person shooters out there. Campaign mode is decided by the decisions you make and how well you play. Multi-player provides non-stop action. To be sure this game can become addictive.
customer_reviews.author: 67datroad

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $45.00 i paid
customer_reviews.text: Repetitive garbage zombies is well it can be fun if you know what your doing but the only way to learn is to keep doing it. story is pretty fun same basic "stop the terrorist" story line, i do like the pick your own wepons however. Multiplayer... im not gonna say it sucks just because im not good at but i do miss the .50 cal Barrett from mw3.
customer_reviews.author: Reclaimer

customer_reviews.title: Eh...
customer_reviews.text: The multiplayer left me furious more often than not. This game needed dedicated servers like no other FPS I have ever played. Bad Spawns, bad networking, and bland multiplayer. I don't play single player so I can't review that part of the game.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Whaahooo!
customer_reviews.text: As always COD never disappoints. The game play is intense, the story is great and the sound immerses you in the COD world. I don't know how the graphics compare to other platforms, but a true gamer will love this on the the 360.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anaya

customer_reviews.title: Same old COD but Zombies is fun
customer_reviews.text: I preordered call of duty black ops 2 cause I enjoy playing COD. I started playing multiplayer and remembered the things that make call of duty, call of duty. Spawn trapping, camping, etc. They have reduced the effects of these but to me its the same call of duty. So multiplayer is alright, but I do like Zombies. Zombies is fun to play with friends and survive Big maps and different guns. So overall it is a decent game
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Best Price around
customer_reviews.text: I am choosing a 5 star rating for a few reasons: 1:It arrived 1 day before the shipping date indicated 2: $38? NO WHERE Could I find this price 3. My husband is a happy camper, he gets to have "man dates" by running around and shooting people. How could you go wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Awesomesauce

customer_reviews.title: I think ity is too violent but if he is happy and his parents don't object
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves thius game. In fact, he did not want a new xbox because he could not play this game. Personally, I think ity is too violent but if he is happy and his parents don't object, than I am happy too.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth D. Bubba

customer_reviews.title: The Game freezes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it brand new here and everytime I start the game it freezes. Doesnt work at all. If i could i would give this a 0 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Isaia

customer_reviews.title: A great use of money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this game believing it would only be useful for occupying my brothers when I need to watch theme, but I quickly found my self drawn to the game. The online multi-player quickly became a favorite of mine and I have since banished my brothers from playing, hogging it to myself. I do not regret buying this game in the least.
customer_reviews.author: Sogati

customer_reviews.title: Best video game yet
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. I became addicted to it for a while, but I have come off that some. I have not played the single player, but xbox live is amazing on it. I don't like the zombie mode on this version, I much prefer the first Black Ops for that. Overall, however, it is a great game.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Greene

customer_reviews.title: Another good entry in COD franchise
customer_reviews.text: The best single player campaign from a COD game in awhile, awesome addictive multi player that I've come to expect from COD franchise. That being said I'm getting kind of sick of having to buy additional maps, they should just include it. But doubt that will happen.
customer_reviews.author: JORGE A. DELPINAL

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: I haven't played too much but from what I have played the game is very stable, quicker load in times, smooth transitions. My only complaint is the recurring annoyance of returning to the main screen if the sign-in information changes. I have had it happen even when guests sign in as secondary players.
customer_reviews.author: justus

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for the Zombies
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge zombie game fan from WaW and BO1. I'm not pleased with the sequel's version of that part of the game. I like a complex objective in a map, but requiring that you have four people makes the execution much more difficult. If they had accounted for people that don't know other players or don't want to waste hours and hours finding a decent PUG and included a single player/local 2-player co-op alternative, I would be much more satisfied with the game. Note: I do not play multi-player online and I have not played the campaign.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Hester

customer_reviews.title: Who doesn’t like black ops two
customer_reviews.text: Who doesn’t like black ops two Great game great packaging this worked perfectly
customer_reviews.author: antwonStark

customer_reviews.title: 11  yr old's favorite games.
customer_reviews.text: zombies zombies zombies That is all that seems to matter here. This is the second disc I had to buy of this game because the first became damaged and the kid could not handle life without it. Yes, my son is addicted to XBox. Especially THIS game.
customer_reviews.author: J.G, Springfield, MO

product_meta.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops II - Xbox 360
product_meta.description:
Pushing the boundaries of what fans have come to expect from the record-setting entertainment franchise, Call of Duty®: Black Ops II propels players into a near future, 21st Century Cold War, where technology and weapons have converged to create a new generation of warfare.

Call of Duty®: Black Ops II Gamescom Accolades


 * "The most ambitious Call of Duty to date" - USA Today
 * "Poised to blow you away" - G4
 * "Treyarch has just vaulted Black Ops II to a new level" - Joystiq
 * "Black Ops II is changing multiplayer. A lot." - Kotaku
 * "A bold departure" - IGN
 * "A whole new level of competitive gaming" - MTV
 * "Brilliant visuals and adrenaline-inducing gameplay" - Forbes
 * "Best of Gamescom" - Gamespot



AMAZON.COM


Call of Duty®: Black Ops II is a First-Person Shooter (FPS) that revolves around unique gameplay that propels the Call of Duty® franchise into a world of future warfare, and back again to the modern era. The game is a sequel to the 2010 release, Call of Duty®: Black Ops, and features returning Black Ops characters Sgt. Frank Woods and Agent Alex Mason, joined by a wealth of new characters. Additional features include: two distinct yet linked playable time periods, advanced weaponry, branching storylines created by player choices in Strike Force missions, exciting multiplayer options, and more.

A whole new future war Call of Duty scenario affected by player decisions in mission play.
View larger TO UNDERSTAND THE FUTURE, YOU MUST UNDERSTAND THE PAST
Pushing the boundaries of what fans have come to expect from the record-setting entertainment franchise, Call of Duty®: Black Ops II propels players into a near future, 21st Century Cold War, where technology and weapons have converged to create a new generation of warfare between old and new foes. In this conflict, the mechanized creations of men reign supreme, facing off against each other as their creators stay safe and unconflicted, and in the process grow ever softer. In this scenario an important question will be asked: What happens when enemy steals the keys? To understand such a possible future, you must understand where you have been.

Players of Call of Duty®: Black Ops II gain an understanding of this and more through the game's additional timeline set in the late Cold War era of the 1980's. Within the campaign story, which spans these two eras, players will see familiar faces such as Alex Mason, his son David Mason, and Sgt. Frank Woods. Linking these together will be the rise of another player in the conflict, Raul Menendez.

KEY GAME FEATURES
 * An all-new Call of Duty®: Black Ops II storyline featuring new characters and and returning characters
 * A unique single-player campaign that contains two time periods linked by characters and their actions
 * Special Strike Force missions, in which the players action affect the outcome of gameplay and the overall campaign
 * A variety of multiplayer modes and play options

ZOMBIES

The Biggest Zombies Experience to Date: Call of Duty®: Black Ops II Zombies features three different ways to survive the zombie apocalypse. Unravel the mysteries of a dying Earth in Tranzit, fight endless waves of zombies in Survival mode, or compete in the new 4z4 last-human-standing mode, Grief.


Tranzit
1-4 player co-op in a large open world with a variety of locations. The new Buildables gameplay elements help players move through each area to find the key tidbits that reveal why they are there and what they must do to survive. All the while, public transportation is still operational, as a bus will regularly stop at each location. Zombies ride for free.

Survival
Recreating the classic mode of just purely surviving the shambling, incoming Zombie horde, Survival mode allows you to play 1-4 players co-op in specific locations from the much larger Tranzit area.

Grief
You and friends can take on up to 4 people in a team vs. Zombies vs. team scenario. 2-8 players are thrown in a situation to be the last humans standing.

MP Technology with Zombies: Call of Duty®: Black Ops II features new and extensive stat tracking as well as leaderboards for bragging rights. New skill-based matchmaking system will allow players of the same ability to take on the horrors of the night in public game modes. For players that are looking for an extra challenge, Zombies features custom games: Headshots only, higher starting rounds, and toggling of extra items are all available.


ADDITIONAL SCREENSHOTS


Returning Black Ops characters.
View larger 
Startling future weaponry.

View larger

A variety of multiplayer options.
View larger
feature_bullets: Strike Force Levels: New to the Call of Duty Franchise, strike force levels provide sandbox style game play experiences, allowing players to take command of any element of their squad at any time
Branching Story lines: Choices the player makes could mean the difference between life and death for some characters and there exists an even greater opportunity for multiple endings
Single Player Character Customization: Choose from a variety of weapons and load outs providing multiple choices for how you approach single player missions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,374 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
